• It is certain the woman is not pregnant, she is in a health facility staffed by skilled health practitioners and she
is highly motivated to prevent a pregnancy.
• It is important to highlight to women that contraceptive method do not protect against HIV and STIs except for
barrier methods hence dual contraception is advised.
These clinical guidelines are aligned with recommendations of the National Contraception clinical guidelines 2019.
